description: Lenart Kova decides against full shutdown, opting instead to patch the BCI to keep scoring running during continuing instability. He informs Lintz, and emergency fixes are deployed alongside the score amnesty.
Daily broadcasts of ghost testimonies reveal systemic abuse and arbitrary erasure under the BCI, sparking citywide debate and emotional public forums.
The Directorate responds to renewed scrutiny by launching a 'Ghosts Among Us' campaign, fueling public fear and mistrust of reinstated citizens. Neighborhood tensions increase.
Violent clashes break out in several districts between supporters and opponents of ghost rights. Lintz and Kova step forward as mediators, urging calm and dialogue.
A leak of Halden’s files reveals he secretly intervened to spare certain people from erasure, reframing his leadership and intensifying debate about the BCI's future.
